user_review: Ordered via Uber Eats. Had a vegetarian combo (green beans, potatoes, and cabbage) as well as a meat combo (minced beef and doro wat), with spicy lamb. Food was solid for Montréal.
Exceptional value and deliciousness. A neighborhood gem. Kind owners, and authentic food

I love Ethiopian food and was sad to see there were only a couple restaurants in the city. However, this place is great! On par taste-wise with the other ones I've been to, although sadly they don't have Tej here. The last time we went we shared the two person platter (we chose for wat and alicha wat) and an order of kitfo. The combo would have certainly been enough for two people but I can't not have kitfo. It was just slightly cooked which was strange to me, but still tasty. Normally I get tibs as well but it wasn't included in the combo and the wots were good. The evening we went in the service was very very slow. It seemed to be only two people for the whole restaurant which was full on a Friday night. Hopefully they were just understaffed that evening. All in all a solid restaurant. I'll definitely be back.

I ate here with a friend a few years ago, the food is exquisite, well seasoned bursting with flavour. There's just enough in a serving to tease your pallet and fill you without feeling overstuffed  the decor is also tastefully done. I'll have to make my way back here soon!

First time trying Ethiopian food and I'm in love people!!! It was so good! I mean, I'm writing this review and all I want to do is get in my car and drive back there to eat their food again.Since it's my first time experiencing this type of cuisine, I can't compare. But my tastebuds and gluttonous soul were sooooo happy lol! Everything was tasty. My cousin that loves Ethiopian food and tried all of the Ethiopian restaurants here and elsewhere said that this is a very very good place. The service and ambiance of this place makes it all the better. They have a Groupon deal and as soon as I got home, I bought the deal. I  can not wait to come back!

This was my first time trying ethiopian food and it did not fail to impress me. My friends and I got the tasting platter which comprised of 2 main dishes + one braised beef and 5 different types of vegetables. You had to get ready to eat with your hands, which makes the experience quite unique as well! We also got a bottle of wine. The price of the platter and the wine was very reasonable.

I went with my girl friend last night. We were recommended by another friend The food was very good. We had the tasting menu for 2 which gives you 3 veggies and 2 meats. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. The flavours are different from the norm. The berbere sauce is very good. Further , it's quite an experience if you have never had Ethiopian food.
Great food and an amazingly friendly owner!Support your local restaurants and business owners !I highly recommend this location, it's incredible!
Go. So so so good. Nice atmosphere and service and beautiful food and presentation. Affordable and delicious.

This is a pretty good Ethiopian place, the people are really nice, and the ambience is great, however Nil Bleu Has better food.  The price is great, drinks are great I really like this place, but when I crave Ethiopian I'm usually going to the other place.

Excellent Ethiopian food at the Queen! The injera and berberi taste excellent! My wife and I had the plate for two with doro wat and minchet. Both were absolutely delicious. I added the chacha Tibs and what a meal! Excellent place for a date or a small group. Intimate setting where you can feel your food before you enjoy it. We are from out of town and we were excited to find this spot! Give it a try!

I love Ethiopian food and Queen Sheba did not disappoint me. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. My friend and I went to the restaurant last night without having a reservation. The restaurant was fully booked, but somehow they managed to give us a seat at the bar. This being said: I recommend to make a reservation in advance :). If you step into the restaurant you smell the spices, and you don't want to leave without having tried their food. They also have a great selection of bottled wines. I wish they had more variety when it comes to ordering by glass.Also, try their coffee!

Thanks to the yelp app, we were able to find this place during our weekend trip to Montreal!!! The food was amazing, seriously good foooood. Really cute place with a nice front porch area where we had our late lunch/early dinner after hours of walk at the royal mountain. The Ethiopian bread injera was nicely sour and soft. The wait stuff guy was also very helpful. We took his recommendations for the food and we were so happy. He also called a cab for us. Very friendly and welcoming. We will definitely return!!!

I lived in Ethiopia a few years ago, and I am always on the lookout for delicious Ethiopian food. I was not disappointed! The vegetable combo (beyaynatu) gave a generous portion of all of my favorites: shiro (chickpea stew), misir wot (lentils), atekelt (cabbage and potatoes), gomen (collard greens)...delicious! The owner is sweet and attentive and humored my broken Amharic. Visiting Montreal from New York, I expected to crave poutine but found myself wanting Ethiopian, and Queen Sheba really hit the spot.

Lovely ambience, the food was very delicious and yummy! Being from a Ethiopian family, I have been eating this food since young but the taste here was just mind boggling! The server was really pleasant and humble! I wish you would open your franchise in New York as well. Thank you for all the lovely  food!

Amazing restaurant with wonderful dish platter to share.I really enjoyed dining here. The dish platter was so unique and had it's own kick of flavour to each of the dish options. The host is friendly and, despite being the only person at the station, he was attentive in servicing throughout the meal. Definitely a place I would return to many times.

First off, if you've never tried Ethiopian cuisine, go try Ethiopian cuisine! And if you're going to try it, try it here. I came here with a group and we ordered the tasting menu. Everyone in our group loved it. We had such a nice variety of what the restaurant offers. The flavours of everything we ate were phenomenal. And the price is definitely right for what you get here. This place will leave you full, but still wanting more!

I had my lunch here today. Honestly, my expectations were low, but I was wrong. Everything was great, food & service & atmosphere. I got the meat combination (chicken and beef) and it was perfect. I have been to many Ethiopian restaurants before, but I could say the food here is the most delicious so far.

Sharing a platter of Ethiopian food with good friends is such a pleasure, but in Montreal we haven't had many affordable options, so I was thrilled to hear about Queen Sheba. The ambiance is wonderful--the tables are well-spaced, but cozy; the space is warm and clean and perfectly lit; there's music, but it's easy to converse. The food is terrific: generous quantities, and fresh, with just the right amount of spice. The service is really top-notch and friendly. Oh, and it's all really affordable! I'm already planning my next visit...
Food was very good. See pictures. The host was friendly and attentive. Only minus right now is that they don't have desserts, but they are looking into it.
excellent experience in queen shebaenthusiastic waitress recommended teff with all kinds of sources and took good care of the vegetarian

3.5starsI expected more out of this place.. I thought it would be more flavorful but the vegetable combo was bland. The meat (doro wat, chacha tibs, kitfo) were okay/good but the portions were really small for the price you pay. Service was kind of slow since there was only one person hosting, waitressing & cleaning but overall it was a good first time experience!

Came here for a quiet dinner on the patio with my girlfriend and had a very pleasant experience.Service was a little slow for how quiet it was but the food itself was rather good and the chef came around to check on the tables that were in the restaurant and he was very nice.

Mind blowing food! For someone who had only known Couscous, it was a pleasant surprise to discover the richness of Ethiopia food. The whiff of homemade spices with carefully selected collection of wine, your appetite will shoots up as high as Simien mountains. And you'll find yourself at heaven when you wrap the gravy with handmade bread...  You would need to roll back home instead of walking.
Nice, contemporary, ethnic atmosphere. Food was delicious. Service was great...very attentive and responsive.  We had the sampler with two stewed meats and six vegetables. We enjoyed it.

Five stars for these five reasons:1. Service: fantastic, so friendly, lovely waiter (rare in Montreal)2. Locally run: by an awesome family who has been in the city since 19923. Food: top notch, incredible variation among the veggie and meat dishes. Everything so tasty, not super spicy, but just enough.4. Atmosphere: very chill, clean, minimal and welcoming decor - not too loud.5. Music: best jazz compilation with fab piano riffs.

I walked in and it felt like home. I'm Ethiopian and this restaurant did not disappoint. The service was excellent and they're able to provide rest recommendations. They can also accommodate a large party. Vegan and vegetarian friendly! First time in Montreal, but I will definitely be back. Thank you!!!

I'd give them zero stars if I could!!! Sign on front door CLEARLY WRITTEN that they were open until 11 pm. We walked in at 10:20 and they turned us away. Wouldn't even let us get take out. With so many other Ethiopian restaurants, we won't be back.

The food was good and everyone was friendly, but the experience overall was mediocre. I love Ethiopian food, so I was excited to come here. I went with a very large group which might have something to do with the problems. The service was very very slow even though we appeared to be one of the few tables in the restaurant. There was a lot of confusion how much food to share and we ended up having to ordered more.If I lived closer I would give it another try with a smaller group of people. I would also only order the vegetarian dishes (they were far superior to the meat based dishes IMO).

Food and service were outstanding. We had a wonderful evening, with food that was absolutely delicious. We picked a mix of vegetables and meat dishes. There are several different combinations either vegetarian, meat, or a combination of the two available, so you can easily find one that you like. And of course everything is served with and on injera, delicious sour dow bread. Can't wait to go back and try out other combinations!

Just went again -- 3 months later -- and it was amazing again.  Service a bit slow, but that's the norm for this kind of food. Incredible vegetarian offerings, generous portions, complex flavors... love this place.

Great food! Not only did we have a great meal but dining with a 9-year-old and 9-month-old, they were extremely helpful making sure both kids had food to eat as well. My husband (who's a bit more food traveled) said it might be the best Ethiopian he's had. We would definitely dine here again!

I came here with a bunch of my buddies on a Friday night. We made a reservation last minute and they were able to seat us quickly. I absolutely LOVED dining here. The wait staff is really polite and the ambiance is perfect for groups. They have several large tables. Plus the food was delicious, so good that we ordered seconds. I believe we had the meat platter to share- I was excited because the meat was halal. But it also had some vegetarian parts. Everything was delicious. Will definitely be back for more!

My wife and I had an excellent, memorable dinner here last night. At the outset we found the decor very cool and the establishment noticeably clean and cared for. The staff people are gracious, friendly, fun and accommodating (little changes like moving a table - it's all good , smiles and laughs.) Extensive menu, and when we were served the food was tasty and intriguing in seasonings. I actually found that my digestive system *liked* it which hasn't liked much lately. We will definitely be going back as it's our neighborhood. Happy to have these newcomers here on the Parc/Plateau.
Amazing food and great ambiance!! Wonderful customer service accompanied by a great selection of jazz music. A must try!

Wow. The most calming and enjoyable dinner place in Montreal I've been to in my four years here. The food is amazing, tons of vegetarian options, and good for sharing. The service is excellent and the whole place has just a very comforting vibe.

Oh dear. I'm always on the lookout for new Ethiopian restaurants so I was very excited to find out about this place. I noticed Queen Sheba while walking past one day, and immediately made plans to go over the weekend. The restaurant is nice and comfortable, the location is convenient, and the staff are lovely, but unfortunatley that's where the positive review ends. My friend and I ordered a couple of vegetarian combos that featured typical Ethiopian fare - lentils in berber sauce, split peas, mixed veggies, spinach, etc. The first thing we noticed was that everything was dry. Normally, the sauces from the food soak through the injera, but these dishes were so dry they were honestly difficult to swallow. The fact that the injera was thicker and denser than I'm used to didn't help. The split peas were also undercooked (crunchy), so we ended up leaving most uneaten. Finally, the taste was underwhelming. Good Ethiopian food is incredible for its spice blends and bursting flavours, but this food almost seemed intentionally bland. I'm left wondering if the other reviewers have never had Ethipian food before, because I'm honestly baffled by the positivity of the previous comments. I hate leaving negative reviews for places that I really want to support. The people here seem wonderful and I would have loved to have found a new regular dinner spot. I only hope that my comments can be helpful in some way, because I would love for this place to succeed. Considering they have good service, a good location, and a nice sized restaurant, they really just need to improve their food in order to have a winning combination.TL;DR: Food is dry and bland. Restaurant is nice and service is great. Wish I could have loved it. One star for the food, second star for the service and overall restaurant experience.

We had not been in Montreal for a long time, and our old standby restaurants no longer exist. We came upon Queen of Sheba accidentally, and it turned out to be the best dining experience in our trip. The atmosphere was casual and relaxed. We had a vegetarian combination dish, and it was excellent. What was unique about this restaurant, though, was the exceptionally friendly and attentive service. We never had to ask or look around to get our water refilled. When the waitress asked how everything was, she seemed to really want to know. Even the chef came to our table to ask how we liked the food. When we asked what one dish was, he told us, and brought us an additional complimentary serving, since we said we liked it. We were told that the restaurant was only 4 months old. We really them the best of luck and would highly recommend it to others.

Absolutely love this restaurants! I'm from Los Angeles and have been so homesick without Ethiopian food. It's very authentic, flavorful, and just bomb overall!  If you're looking for a good Ethiopian restaraunt this is your go to!

This was a fun spot to go to with a group. We were mostly veg, so didn't get to try the meat yet- but everything was yummy with lots of selection- And when you run out of Enjera bread, they keep bringing you more until you polish it all off! Also they brought the extra portions in a separate bowl so there was sooo much food to enjoy. I have a feeling the meat would be even better. The ambiance was ok- not as cozy as I would have liked and the lighting is a little dark and night clubby while I prefer more of a La Khaima restaurant vibe but that didn't take away from the experience. Family run- really friendly service. They also serve alcohol.

Stopped at this restaurant after spending a day cross country skiing; it hit the spot! As an Ethiopian food lover I have to say this was some of the best I've ever had! A huge variety of vegetarian and meet options, beer, and lots of wine. Would highly recommend all tourists to stop by and if you're a local, make this part of your usual repertoire!

Love this place. We have eaten at so many different Ethiopian restaurants in different cities and this is by far my favorite. The ambience is elegant and tasteful, the service was excellent and the food Exquisite. Can't wait to go here again

Charming and delicious. Easy 5-star. I'm a big fan of Ethiopian food, and this place hit the spot. Had the veggie communal plate - they also gave us an extra basket of injera (essential). The staff are v lovely too.

Very authentic Ethiopian food! The service was good! The owner personally came out and asked us how the food was. One thing that was different from what I'm used to for Ethiopian food was that the spicy level was more mild compared to what I had before. Overall it was a great experience!!

Great place for delicious food.  The interior is modern and chic and incorporates Ethiopian art.  Waiter was very nice and brought us Ethiopian coffee for free. Injera was perfect.  Yeshiro Wat and Gomen also delicious.  Chicken was tender and juicy.  Ethiopian tea is a must.   Reasonable prices and great food.  Would definitely go back when in Montreal.

This place is so bad that I felt compelled to write a review the second after "finishing" our take out from there (I use quotes, because we certainly did not finish a single dish we ordered and only ate enough to quiet our hunger before we eventually make a second meal at home). We ordered the Ye doro wat, which is a common dish in every Ethiopian restaurant, consisting of chicken simmered in a berbere sauce and a hard-boiled egg. This dish was probably the least edible of the three we ordered, due to the sauce (which comprised 70% of the dish) being inordinately BITTER, and also tasting like burnt oil. The chicken was pretty hard and not flavorful and the egg was completely overcooked and hard to even cut in two. The next dish, yellow split peas, was one of the blandest, saddest dishes I've had the displeasure of eating recently! It was basically mashed split peas with no seasoning. Anyone who has had the chance to have good Ethiopian knows the amazingly complex spiciness simple veggie dishes can have, and this was like eating baby food. The last dish we ordered, Alitcha, was supposed to be tender meat cubes with potatoes and seasoned with various spices. I literally didn't even realize this was a meat dish when I first opened the container, since it looked like possibly pureed lentils. It was basically a greasy, oily mess of miniscule pieces of meat, and by miniscule, I mean each piece of meat resembling a morsel of ground meat in size. This dish tasted overcooked and no seasoning. Absolutely unmemorable. To top it off, we live across the street from this establishment and yet every dish was lukewarm at best. I suspect a lot of reheating going on (something you would never see at East Afrika in NDG!), hence the bitter oil taste in the meat dishes. The injera was a darker brown than I've ever experienced and so incredibly sour that even people who like sourdough would have a hard time eating this. Completely unsatisfying and sad. Please save your wallets and expectations and skip this place!

I love Ethiopian food, and this place définetly met my expectations. The server was very friendly and helped us make a decision on what to order and it turned out perfect. The decor is very nice and cozy and best of all, the prices are right on target. I highly recommend.

The food is authentic and delicious. The staff is friendly. There were many Ethiopian families enjoying the food and celebrating events it was like a great travel and food experience. I will go again for sure.

Food is delicious! The wait time can be a little lengthy so it's probably not a good place to come if you're in a rush. The prices are accurate for what you get, and they alcoholic beverages are pretty cheap. They have about 9-10 tables inside and a patio. Overall great food!

Exceptional service, wonderful food and an overall excellent experience. 10/10 would recommend and plan on going back soon! Great recommendations by the staff to choose from the expansive menu. Cannot say enough good things about this restaurant!
Finger licking good. Very fresh. Delicious. Great price. Excellent service. Excellent ambience. They customized the combos to suit our likings. Highly recommend this place for everyone.
